decision_conditions: The proposal would, by its depth, bulk, height, and location, result in a built form which would be harmful to the amenities of the neighbouring occupiers at 71 Mulberry Crescent and 75 Mulberry Crescent through loss of light and outlook, contrary to Policies D3 and D6 of The London Plan and Policies DMHD 1 and DMHB 11 of Hillingdon Council's Local Plan Part Two Development Management Policies (2020), which seek to protect residential amenity.

The proposed extension's design, scale, and appearance would not appear subordinate and sympathetic to the dwelling and neighbouring properties. The inappropriate extensions would be out of keeping with the prevailing development pattern to the detriment of the subject dwelling's appearance, the street scene's visual amenity, and the area's character. The proposal is contrary to Policies D3 and D6 of The London Plan and Policies DMHB 11 and DMHD 1 of the London Borough of Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 Development Management Policies (2020).
description: Erection of a part single and part two-storey side and rear extension, following the demolition of a conservatory and two sheds
